Title: Navigating a Mid-Career Tech Stack Shift - Engineering Manager AMA
Description:
You want to switch tech stacks, but you're panicking. All of that hard work goes completely down the drain. You start back at square one as a junior developer.

... Or do you? Let's discuss!

As with all livestreams, I'm looking forward to answering YOUR questions! So join me live and ask in the chat, or you can comment now and I can try to get it answered while I stream.

Title: Building a CoAP application on Ariel OS
Description:
Ariel OS is an embedded operating system written in Rust,
whose first version 0.1. was released recently.
It is designed for "constrained devices" (a.k.a. "embedded devices" or "IoT devices"),
that is, electronic devices with little power and storage ‚Äì
think "what is in your remote control" and not "what is on your computer".
The Constrained Application Protocol (CoAP) is a networking protocol for the same group of devices.
It is similar to HTTP in its semantics,
but tuned to simple implementation and small messages that work over the most low-power networks.
